item.title: Problem Set 5
item.description:
Week 5 Problem Sets

Did you know that the popular 3x3x3 Rubik’s cube has 43,252,003,274,489,856,000 valid permutations? It means that it’s nearly impossible to predict the state of a scrambled cube. Yet people have managed to solve it in (way) less than 5 seconds.

Combinatorics problems in competitive programming is always fun to solve, albeit sometimes difficult. If you can find the correct formula/pattern, your solution can be very short. They could also be good practice for Math 240, too!


By Imk3nnyma - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, Link

CodeForces

  • CodeForces 630F: Selection of Personnel
  • CodeForces 630G: Challenge Pennants
  • CodeForces 1096B: Substring Removal
  • CodeForces 1061C: Multiplicity
  • CodeForces 1084C: The Fair Nut and String
  • CodeForces 1105C: Ayoub and Lost Array
  • CodeForces 1172B: Nauuo and Circle
  • CodeForces 1140E: Palindrome-less Arrays

Kattis

  • Riječi
  • Character Development
  • Catalan Numbers
  • Odd Binomial Coefficients
  • Batmanacci
  • Election

item.title: Problem Set 4
item.description:
Week 4 Problem Sets

If you want some basic exercises with Union-Find disjoint sets right after reading the chapters, go for the problems on Kattis!

CodeForces

  • CodeForces 843A: Sorting by Subsequences
  • CodeForces 886A: Petya and Catacombs
  • CodeForces 875B: Sorting the Coins
  • CodeForces 1139C: Edgy Trees

Harder CodeForces problems, only attempt them if you’re up for more challenges

  • CodeForces 1131F: Asya and Kittens
  • CodeForces 1012B: Chemical table

Kattis

  • Almost Union-Find
  • Association for Control Over Minds
  • Coast Length

item.title: Problem Set 3
item.description:
Week 3 Problem Sets

If you study graphs in which edges can link more than two nodes, you’re more properly called a hyperedgelord.

  • CodeForces 580C: Kefa and Park
  • CodeForces 1167C: News Distribution
  • CodeForces 1143C: Queen
  • CodeForces 1144F: Graph Without Long Directed Paths

  • Faulty Robot
  • Breaking Bad

item.title: Problem Set 2
item.description:
Week 2 Problem Sets

This week, I listed CodeForces problems in order of increasing rank (as dictated by CodeForces). This might not be a good indication of difficulty, however… We also tried to reduce the number of questions so everyone will have attempted more of the same questions when we discuss.
-Imad

I also suggest starting with Knapsack, from the Kattis section - its pretty vanilla.

CodeForces

  • CodeForces 961B: Lecture Sleep
  • CodeForces 698A: Vacations
  • CodeForces 855B: Marvolo Gaunt’s Ring
  • CodeForces 573B: Bear and Blocks

Kattis

  • Knapsack
  • Restaurant Orders
  • Longest Increasing Subsequence
  • Spiderman’s Workout

Sorry... I had to...
